body.section: A complete clouds.yaml file is available here for reference.

section.p: If you are deploying Helion Code Engine, append the helionce section to the clouds.yml file as described below:
section.pre: clouds: mycloud: ... helionce: deployer_key: helionce-shared deployer_flavor: 3 deployer_ntp_servers: ntpservers deployer_dns_servers: dnsservers deployer_cloud: 'mycloud' auth: auth_url: http://10.22.200.2:35357/v3 project_name: admin username: admin password: verystrongpassword

dlentry.dd: The flavor to use for the deployer instance, Default value: 3Creating a Large deployer (value: 4) may result in a No space in directory error message. If this happens, reset the flavor value to 3 (medium) and try again.
This value must match the name of the section you created in the Platform Configuration section. In the examples, the name is mycloud

dd.p: This is the value of the OS_AUTH_URL variable from ~/service.osrc
This is the value of the OS_PROJECT_NAME variable from ~/service.osrcgrep OS_AUTH_URL ~/service.osrc export OS_PROJECT_NAME=admin
This is the value of the OS_USERNAME variable from ~/service.osrc
This is the value of the OS_PASSWORD variable from ~/service.osrcgrep OS_PASSWORD ~/service.osrc export OS_PASSWORD=verystrongpassword
